revisions.rev:
{{Infobox tvseason | season_name = Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
''Season 13' | bgcolour = #E2010A | fgcolour = #FFFFFF | image = [[File:Law and Order Special Victims Unit Season 13 Cast.jpg|263px]] | caption = The cast of the thirteenth season. | show_name = ''[[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]]'' | region_1 = | country = United States | network = [[NBC]] | first_aired = {{start date|2011|9|21}} | last_aired = {{end date|''present''}} | num_episodes = 9 (aired) | prev_season = [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 12)|Season 12]] | next_season = | episode_list = '' [[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes]]'' }} The '''13th season''' of ''[[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]]'' debuted on September 21, 2011 on [[NBC]].{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=NBC Announces Fall Premiere Dates - 'Chuck,' 'Grimm' Premiere October 21; Early Premiere for 'Parenthood'|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/07/06/nbc-announces-fall-premiere-dates-chuck-grimm-premiere-october-2-early-premiere-for-parenthood/97330/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=July 6, 2011|accessdate=July 6, 2011}} This season ''Law & Order: SVU'' will be broadcast without any other running U.S. [[Law & Order (franchise)|''Law & Order'' series]]. The original ''[[Law & Order]]'' was cancelled in May 2010, its direct spin-off ''[[Law & Order: LA]]'' was cancelled in May 2011, and [[USA Network]] ended ''[[Law & Order: Criminal Intent]]'' in June 2011.{{cite news | first=Michael | last= Ausiello | title=It's official: NBC cancels 'Law & Order' | date=May 14, 2010 | url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2010/05/14/nbc-cancels-law-order-2/}}{{cite web|title='Law & Order: Los Angeles' Cancelled By NBC|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/05/13/law-order-los-angeles-cancelled-by-nbc/92515/|publisher=tvbythenumbers.com|accessdate=May 13, 2011}}{{cite news | first=Matt | last=Mitovich | title=No Reprieve for Law & Order: CI: 'It Was a Good Series Finale,' Says USA Network Boss | date=July 15, 2011 | url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/07/law-order-criminal-intent-series-finale-confirmed/}} ==Cast changes and returning characters== On May 14, 2011, [[TVLine]] reported that [[Mariska Hargitay]] will return for a thirteenth season while [[Christopher Meloni]] had not come to terms with his contract. Hargitay's character will be paired with what was thought to be Meloni's character for the first 13 episodes. Initial reports indicated that she would appear in only the first 13 episodes, and then her character would be promoted to a supervisor position with a new detective replacing her,{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/exclusive-mariska-hargitay-inks-new-law-order-svu-deal-may-pass-baton-to-jennifer-love-hewitt/|title=Law & Order: SVU Scoop: Hargitay Inks New Deal, Jennifer Love Hewitt May Succeed Her|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|work=[[TVLine]]|publisher=[[Mail.com Media]]|date={{nowrap|May 14}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 14}}, 2011}} however NBC chairman Bob Greenblatt clarified later that August that she would be in every episode of the season.{{cite web|last=Porter|first=Rick|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2011/08/law-order-svu-mariska-hargitay-isnt-going-anywhere-nbc-chief-says.html|title='Law & Order: SVU': Mariska Hargitay isn't going anywhere, NBC chief says|work=[[Zap2it]]|date=August 1, 2011|accessdate=October 1, 2011}} NBC was considering [[Jennifer Love Hewitt]] to replace Hargitay. Greenblatt later told TVLine, "Jennifer Love is somebody we've been circling, but I don't know that that is going to happen at all".{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/chris-meloni-exits-law-order-svu/|title=Exclusive: Chris Meloni Exits Law & Order: SVU|last=Webb Mitovich|first=Matt|last2=Ausiello|first2=|authorlink2=Michael Ausiello|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|May 24}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 24}}, 2011}} It was later reported that Jennifer Love Hewitt would not be coming to the show.{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/06/svu-update-jennifer-love-hewitt/|title=SVU No Longer Looking to Collar Love Hewitt|last=Masters|first=Meg|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|June 10}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 11}}, 2011}} Meloni's contract negotiations fell through, and on {{nowrap|May 24, 2011}}, TVLine reported that he would be exiting the show. Mariska Hargitay said that "He inspired me every day with his integrity, his extraordinary talent and his commitment to the truth. I love him deeply and will miss him terribly â I'm so excited to see what he'll do next."{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/mariska-hargitay-chris-meloni-law-order-svu-exit/|title=Mariska Hargitay Laments Chris Meloni's SVU Exit: 'I Love Him and Will Miss Him Terribly'|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|May 27}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 27}}, 2011}} On August 1, 2011, Greenblatt confirmed that Meloni's character would not be killed off. [[File:Law and Order SVU.png|thumb|left|Pino and Hargitay filming the fifth episode "Missing Pieces" on September 20, 2011.]] On June 10, 2011, co-star [[Ice-T]] renewed his contract for two more seasons (seasons 13 and 14).{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/06/ice-t-law-order-svu-renews-contract/|title=Ice-T Staying Put on Law & Order: SVU, Inks New Two-Year Contract|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|June 10}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 11}}, 2011}} Kate Ward of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' felt co-star Ice-T should have replaced Meloni, instead of searching for a new cast member.{{cite news|url=http://popwatch.ew.com/2011/06/10/law-order-svu-ice-t-chris-meloni/|title=Why can't Ice-T replace Chris Meloni on 'Law & Order: SVU'? |last=Ward|first=Kate|work=Entertainment Weekly|date={{nowrap|June 10}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 11}}, 2011}} Actors [[Danny Pino]], [[Kevin Alejandro]], [[David Conrad]], [[Michael Raymond-James]], and later [[Rhys Coiro]] were tested June 21, opposite Hargitay as replacements for Meloni. NBC and creator Dick Wolf aimed for a younger female and male actor as they try to extend the series' lifespan by several more years.{{cite news|url=http://www.deadline.com/2011/06/finalists-danny-pino-kevin-alejandro-david-conrad-michael-raymond-james-to-test-for-law-order-svu-male-lead/|title=UPDATE: Five Testing For 'SVU' Male Lead - Danny Pino, Kevin Alejandro, David Conrad, Michael Raymond-James, Rhys Coiro|last= ANDREEVA|first=NELLIE|work=Deadline|date={{nowrap|June 20}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 21}}, 2011}} On June 27, 2011 NBC announced that [[Kelli Giddish]] of NBC's cancelled ''[[Chase (2010 TV series)|Chase]]'' and Pino of CBS's ''[[Cold Case (TV series)|Cold Case]]'' would be brought on as the new series regulars.{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=NBC Signs Kelli Giddish (''Chase'') and Danny Pino (''Cold Case'') as New Detectives for ''Law & Order: Special Victims Unit''|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/06/27/nbc-signs-kelli-giddish-chase-and-danny-pino-cold-case-as-new-detectives-for-law-order-special-victims-unit/96694/|work=TV by the Numbers|publisher=[[Zap2it]]|date={{nowrap|June 27}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 27}}, 2011}} [[Stephanie March]] and [[Diane Neal]] returned to ''SVU'' in their roles as Assistant District Attorneys [[Alexandra Cabot]] and [[Casey Novak]] respectively for "an undetermined number of episodes".{{cite web|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|title=Law & Order: SVU Scoop: Stephanie March, Diane Neal Heading Back to Court|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/07/law-order-svu-stephanie-march-diane-neal/|work=TV Line|date={{nowrap|July 5}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|July 5}}, 2011}} Neal told [[TV Guide]], "It's back on track to what the original ''SVU'' was intended to be, which is about sex crimes and crimes against children, it's got more of a nitty-gritty feel." She says having her and Stephanie March back provides a familiarity for viewers now that original cast member Chris Meloni is gone. "I think they should put us in the court room together!" she says about March.{{cite news|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Season-13-1036245.aspx|title=VIDEO: Law & Order: SVU's Diane Neal Says Season 13 Has a Nitty-Gritty Feel|last=Ross|first=Robyn|work=[[TV Guide]]|date={{nowrap|August 9}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|August 9}}, 2011}} On July 17, 2011, [[B. D. Wong]] announced on Twitter during an ''SVU'' marathon dedicated to his character that he departed the cast of the show. In response to a tweet about his character's status in season 13, he said, "I actually do not return for Season 13, I am jumping to ''[[Awake (TV series)|Awake]]''. It's awesome!". Wong added, "I don't know if or when I'll be back [on SVU]! It was amazing to have such a cool job for 11 years and to be a real NY Actor." There is no announcement of a replacement.{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/07/svu-bd-wong-wont-return-season-13/|title=Fall TV Scoop: B.D. Wong Reveals His SVU Fate|last=Mitovich|first=Matt|work=[[TVLine]]|publisher=[[Mail.com Media]]|date={{nowrap|July 17}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|July 17}}, 2011}} [[Tamara Tunie]] was moved from the main cast credits to a "special guest" starring role. == Production == [[Warren Leight]] replaced [[Neal Baer]] as [[showrunner]], after Baer moved to [[CBS Television Studios]].{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118035267|title=Warren Leight tapped for NBC's 'SVU' |last=Wallenstein|first=Andrew|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date={{nowrap|April 11}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 29}}, 2011}} NBC executive [[Robert Greenblatt]] said the network planned to "reset the tone" of the show but have the storylines "still be compelling but a little more grounded".{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/mariska-hargitay-christopher-meloni-exit-192897|title=Mariska Hargitay Laments Chris Meloni's SVU Exit: 'I Love Him and Will Miss Him Terribly'|last=M. Fernandez|first=Sofia|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date={{nowrap|May 28}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 29}}, 2011}} Filming began in July 2011 and the first three episodes being finished mid-August.{{cite news|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/moviestvmusic/news/jennifer-love-hewitt-no-longer-a-contender-for-law-and-order-svu-role-2011136|title=Jennifer Love Hewitt No Longer a Contender for Law and Order: SVU Role|last=Corneau|first=Allison|work=[[Us Weekly]]|date={{nowrap|June 13}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 17}}, 2011}} Production to resume on the rest of the season after [[Labor Day]] (September 5, 2011).{{cite news|title=Season 13 Is Almost Here!|url=http://www.nbc.com/law-and-order-special-victims-unit/production-blog/season-13-is-almost-here/|accessdate=August 23, 2011|newspaper=[[NBC]]|date=August 22, 2011}} Casting director Jonathan Strauss also took on the job of co-producer on the show, his promotion was described as a rare move in the television industry. Strauss told ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', "[[NBC Universal|NBCUniversal]] and [[Wolf Films]] have afforded me this unique opportunity, and in television, a fairly unprecedented one, to serve as both casting director and co-producer on ''SVU''."{{cite news|last=Goldberg|first=Lesley|title='Law & Order: SVU' Casting Director Gets Rare Bump to Co-Producer (Exclusive)|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/law-order-svu-casting-director-227966|accessdate=August 26, 2011|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=August 26, 2011}} == Cast == {{see also|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit characters}} ===Principal cast=== * [[Mariska Hargitay]] as [[Olivia Benson|Det. Olivia Benson]] * [[Danny Pino]] as [[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit characters#Nick Amaro|Det. Nick Amaro]] * [[Kelli Giddish]] as [[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit characters#Amanda Rollins|Det. Amanda Rollins]] * [[Richard Belzer]] as [[John Munch|Sgt. John Munch]] * [[Ice-T]] as [[Fin Tutuola|Det. Fin Tutuola]] * [[Dann Florek]] as [[Donald Cragen|Capt. Don Cragen]] ===Recurring Cast=== * [[Stephanie March]] as [[Alexandra Cabot|ADA Alexandra Cabot]] * [[Diane Neal]] as [[Casey Novak|ADA Casey Novak]] * [[Linus Roache]] as [[Mike Cutter|Bureau Chief EADA Michael Cutter]] * [[Tamara Tunie]] as [[Melinda Warner|Dr. Melinda Warner]] * [[Ron Rifkin]] as Marvin Exley ===Guest stars=== [[Linus Roache]] reprises his role of [[Mike Cutter|EADA Michael Cutter]] from the [[Law & Order|original ''Law & Order'' series]] in the season premiere episode. Cutter has been promoted at the DA's office to Bureau Chief EADA in which he oversees the ADAs assigned to the Special Victims Unit. Show runner [[Warren Leight]] stated, "If Cutter was a bit of a hot head in the past, the passage of time and some added responsibility in his new job has made him more mature, and perhaps a bit more jaded." Roache had to say, "I learned a lot from my time on ''Law & Order'' and it's going to be interesting to experiment with Cutter's development in this new context â I think Special Victims is going to be an area where Cutter's passion for justice can really come forth."{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Law & Order Alum Linus Roache to Reprise Role on SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Linus-Roache-1036212.aspx|accessdate=August 8, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=August 8, 2011}} [[Franco Nero]] guest starred in the season premiere episode as an Italian dignitary accused of rape, evoking the [[Dominique Strauss-Kahn sexual assault case|Dominique Strauss-Kahn arrest]].{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Exclusive: International Film Star Takes on Dominique Strauss-Kahn for Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-DSK-Nero-1036309.aspx|accessdate=August 11, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=August 11, 2011}} [[imdbname:0308150|Kathleen Garrett]] plays the Italian dignitary's "stand-by-your-man" wife, [[Ron Rifkin]] played his savvy defense lawyer - similar to Strauss-Kahn's real-life lawyer, [[Benjamin Brafman]].{{cite news|last= |first=ANDY CAMPBELL and EMILY SMITH|title="Law & Order" shooting Dominique Strauss-Kahn related episode on East 58th Street|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/dsk_on_role_8KwTyPuFr3i8i0ocYNDDVJ|accessdate=August 17, 2011|newspaper=''[[New York Post]]''|date=August 17, 2011}} [[National Basketball Association|NBA]] stars [[Carmelo Anthony]] ([[New York Knicks]]) and [[Chris Bosh]] ([[Miami Heat]]) play themselves in cameo guest appearances in the episode titled, "[[#ep2|Personal Fouls]]". [[Mehcad Brooks]] plays Prince Miller, a fictional basketball superstar who was once one of the coach's prodigies. Rapper/actor [[Heavy D]] plays Miller's cousin and business manager, Supreme. Anthony and Bosh appeared in the opening scene and episode climax.{{cite news|title=NBA Stars Carmelo Anthony and Chris Bosh to Make Guest Appearances on Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.nbc.com/news/2011/08/22/nba-stars-carmelo-anthony-and-chris-bosh-to-make-guest-appearances-on-law-order-svu/index.php|newspaper=''[[NBC]]''|accessdate=August 22, 2011|date=August 22, 2011}}{{cite news|last=Norman|first=Randy|title=Mehcad Brooks: Good to Be Bad|url=http://www.bet.com/news/celebrities/2011/08/10/mehcad-brooks-good-to-be-bad.html|accessdate=August 10, 2011|newspaper=''[[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]''|date=August 10, 2011}} [[Kyle MacLachlan]] guest starred on an episode titled "Blood Brothers" as Andrew Raines, a charming, seductive Master of the Universe-esque philanthropist in his 50s who is part of one of New York's royal families, he's a powerful politician whose family is embroiled in a scandal. [[Paige Turco]] portrayed Andrew's (MacLachlan's) wife Kathleen, who is described as "charming, charismatic and fiercely protective of her family". MacLachlan and Turco have appeared on ''SVU'' before; MacLachlan in the [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 6)|season 6]] episode "[[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 6)#ep6|Conscience]]" as Dr. Brett Morton, a man who literally got away with murder for the sake of avenging his son's death. Turco was in the [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 3)|third season]] episode "[[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 3)#ep10|Ridicule]]" as a woman named Pam Adler who aided in gang raping a male stripper.{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Law & Order: SVU Collars Kyle MacLachlan for Guest Role|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Kyle-MacLachlan-1035518.aspx|accessdate=July 21, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=July 21, 2011}}{{cite news|last=Wightman|first=Catriona|title=Kyle MacLachlan, Paige Turco to guest in 'Law & Order: SVU'|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/tv/news/a331142/kyle-maclachlan-paige-turco-to-guest-in-law--order-svu.html|accessdate=July 22, 2011|newspaper=''[[Digital Spy]]''|date=July 22, 2011}} The episode is inspired by the [[Arnold Schwarzenegger#Infidelity and divorce|infidelity and divorce of Arnold Schwarzenegger]].{{cite news | first=Michael | last=Ausiello | title=Exclusive: Law & Order: SVU Takes on Arnold Schwarzenegger Scandal | date=July 19, 2011 | url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/07/law-order-svu-arnold-schwarzenegger-scandal/}} [[T.R. Knight]] guest starred as a suspected serial rapist who consistently maintains his innocence despite overwhelming evidence.{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Exclusive: Grey's Alum T.R. Knight Plots TV Return on Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-TR-Knight-1035879.aspx|accessdate=July 31, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=July 31, 2011}} [[Charlie Tahan]] made an appearance following news that Season 13 will feature a return of Calvin Arliss,http://twitter.com/#!/Mariska/status/119085367537319936 Olivia's foster child for two episodes in Season 12. In "Missing Pieces", Arliss is seen with Olivia and his elder foster family, presumably his grandparents from Vermont to whom he was sent to live with by his mother Vivian Arliss ([[Maria Bello]]). [[Andre Braugher]] will be portraying Bayard Ellis on a recurring basis, Ellis is a high-powered defense attorney for the underprivileged who becomes a civil rights champion, he may get close with [[Olivia Benson|Detective Olivia Benson]] ([[Mariska Hargitay]]). Braugher guest starred in a sixth season episode of the original ''Law & Order'' series as [[Frank Pembleton]], who originally worked in the Baltimore City Police Department's Homicide Squad with [[John Munch|Detective John Munch]] ([[Richard Belzer]]) on ''[[Homicide: Life on the Street]]''.{{cite news|last=ANDREEVA|first=NELLIE|title=Andre Braugher To Do Arc On âL&O: SVUâ|url=http://www.deadline.com/2011/08/andre-braugher-to-do-arc-on-lo-svu/|accessdate=August 23, 2011|newspaper=''Deadline''|date=August 23, 2011}} New show runner Warren Leight described Ellis as, "I want the squad room and the legal team to have worthy adversaries, not to have straw men that they can easily take down, he's really smart, a very successful defense attorney who, in an effort to expiate his guilt, has started to defend those black and Latino youths who don't get good defense in New York. He sees an encroaching world of police and district attorney's office tyranny, and he's out to subvert it or to try to get the playing field back to where it was before 9/11."{{cite news|last=Adam Bryant and Natalie Abrams|title=Mega Buzz: The Bones Baby, a Housewives Relapse and a Minds Reunion|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Mega-Buzz-Bones-Desperate-Housewives-Spoilers-1038819.aspx|accessdate=October 20, 2011|newspaper=TV Guide|date=October 19, 2011}} [[Sofia Vassilieva]] will guest star in the same episode as Braugher is to debut. Vassilieva portrayed Sarah Reese, a self-reliant, bohemian girl and shining star of her middle-class suburban family who comes to New York City on a piano scholarship, she loses her inner light after sheâs attacked in her own apartment.{{cite news|last=Slezak|first=Michael|title=Exclusive: Law & Order: SVU Casts Medium Teenager in Harrowing Role|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/09/exclusive-law-order-svu-sofia-vassilieva-medium-casting/|accessdate=September 29, 2011|newspaper=''TVLine''|date=September 29, 2011}} In "Russian Brides", [[Timothy Busfield]] and [[Izabella Miko]] guest starred, Busfield played a widower whose fiance (played by Miko) mysteriously disappears. [[Natasha Lyonne]] and [[Carrie Preston]] will guest star in an episode titled "Educated Guess". Lyonne will play Gia, a patient at a psychiatric hospital, while Preston will play her aunt. The hospital becomes a point of interest for SVU detectives due to a possible rape case.{{cite news|last=Kenneally|first=Tim|title=Law and Order announce guest stars|url=http://www.calgaryherald.com/entertainment/Order+announce+guest+stars/5553550/story.html|accessdate=October 14, 2011|newspaper=Calgary Herald|date=October 15, 2011}} Comedian [[Gilbert Gottfried]] will guest star in an episode titled "Lost Traveler"; scheduled to air on November 30. Executive producer Warren Leight explains he was looking for a colorful character to take the snooze factor away from a new under-appreciated technical IT character in the precinct. "Those scenes can be dry, so I thought he'd be interesting," says Warren, who imagines he'll be bringing back Gilbert's character (tentatively named Leo Gerber) "from time to time."{{cite news|last=Keck|first=Willam|title=Keck's Exclusives: Gilbert Gottfried to Annoy SVU Cast|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Gilbert-Gottfried-SVU-1039055.aspx|accessdate=October 26, 2011|newspaper=''TV Guide''|date=October 26, 2011}} [[Treat Williams]] will guest star in an episode entitled "Spiraling Down", Williams will play Jake Stanton, a former all-star quarterback caught up in a sting operation with an underage prostitute. Stanton will be represented by famed defense attorney Bayard Ellis (Andre Braugher). Later in the season [[Michael Weston]] will return to the show to portray Olivia's brother, Simon Marsden.{{cite news|last=Keck|first=Willam|title=Keck's Exclusives: The Story Behind Law & Order: SVU's Mystery Necklace|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Mystery-Necklace-1039160.aspx|accessdate=October 30, 2011|newspaper=''TV Guide''|date=October 31, 2011}} [[Laura Benanti]] will guest star as [[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit characters#Nick Amaro|Detective Nick Amaro's]] wife, who returns from overseas and she and Amaro must figure out where their relationship stands with thier 4-year-old daughter named Zara ([[imdbname:4731251|Alison Fernandez]]) who was first seen in "Missing Pieces". Benanti, will film one episode with the potential of a multi-episode arc.{{cite news|last=Ross|first=Robyn|title=Exclusive: Law & Order: SVU Casts Detective Amaro's Estranged Wife|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Laura-Benanti-1039709.aspx|accessdate=November 14, 2011|newspaper=''TV Guide''|date=November 14, 2011}} [[Holt McCallany]] will be guest-starring in the episode "Official Story", which will air in January 2012. This marks the second time McCallany is reunited with show runner [[Warren Leight]], who was the showrunner of the short-lived FX series ''[[Lights Out (TV series)|Lights Out]]''. McCallany also guest starred in the [[Amends (Law & Order: Criminal Intent)|seventh season premiere episode]] of ''[[Law & Order: Criminal Intent]]'', at the time Leight was show runner of it as well. == Episodes == {{see also|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes}} {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- style="color:#FFFFFF" ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Season
no. ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Series
no. ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Title ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Directed by ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Written by ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Original air date ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | Prod. code ! style="background-color: #E2010A;" | U.S. Viewers
(millions) {{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=1 |EpisodeNumber2=273 |Title=[[Scorched Earth (Law & Order: Special Victims Unit)|Scorched Earth]] |DirectedBy=[[imdbname:0806252|Michael Slovis]] |WrittenBy=[[imdbname:4546012|David Matthews]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|09|21}} |ProdCode=13003 |Aux4=7.63{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/09/22/wednesday-final-ratings-the-x-factor-modern-family-the-middle-revenge-and-others-adjusted-up/104596/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'The X Factor,' 'Modern Family,' 'The Middle,' 'Revenge' And Others Adjusted Up|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=September 22, 2011|accessdate=September 22, 2011}} |ShortSummary= The detectives of the Special Victims Unit are called to the scene when a hotel maid ([[Anika Noni Rose]]) reports being assaulted by Italian diplomat Robert Distasio ([[Franco Nero]]). Bureau Chief Mike Cutter ([[Linus Roache]]) and Assistant District Attorney Alex Cabot ([[Stephanie March]]) prosecute the high-profile case, which quickly grows more complicated as the maid's credibility is publicly questioned. Detective Amanda Rollins ([[Kelli Giddish]]) joins the Manhattan SVU from Atlanta, while Detective Benson struggles to cope with the fall-out from the shooting in the precinct. * Inspired by the [[Dominique Strauss-Kahn sexual assault case]]. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=2 |EpisodeNumber2=274 |Title=Personal Fouls |DirectedBy=[[imdbname:0571078|Tim McKay]] |WrittenBy=[[imdbname:0326734|Bryan Goluboff]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|09|28}} |ProdCode=13002 |Aux4=7.24{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/09/29/wednesday-final-ratings-x-factor-survivor-the-middle-modern-family-csi-l-happy-endings-adjusted-down/105383/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'X Factor,' 'Survivor,' 'The Middle,' 'Modern Family,' 'CSI,' 'L&O:SVU' Adjusted Up; 'Happy Endings' Adjusted Down|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=September 29, 2011|accessdate=September 29, 2011}} |ShortSummary= As Coach Ray Masters ([[Dan Lauria]]) is inducted to the Metro Basketball Hall of Fame by former students, an ex-player, Stevie Harris ([[Aaron Tveit]]) accuses the coach of sexually abusing him as a child. Detective Nick Amaro ([[Danny Pino]]) transfers into the SVU squad from narcotics and is thrown on to the case. The detectives interview former players but no one admits to abuse, forcing Benson and Fin to dig deeper into Coach Ray's most successful player, basketball star Prince Miller ([[Mehcad Brooks]]) and his manager/cousin ([[Heavy D]]). * Inspired by the [[Graham James (ice hockey)|Graham James]]/[[Sheldon Kennedy]]/[[Theo Fleury]]/Ernest Lorch sexual assault cases. * Special cameo appearances by [[Carmelo Anthony]] and [[Chris Bosh]]. * Note: This episode marked Heavy D's final acting appearance before his death on November 8, 2011. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=3 |EpisodeNumber2=275 |Title=Blood Brothers |DirectedBy=[[Tom DiCillo]] |WrittenBy=[[Warren Leight]] & [[Julie Martin (writer)|Julie Martin]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|10|05}} |ProdCode=13001 |Aux4=7.98{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/10/06/wednesday-final-ratings-modern-family-the-middle-up-all-night-adjusted-up-revenge-happy-endings-raising-hope-adjusted-down/106408/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'Modern Family,' 'The Middle,' 'Up All Night' Adjusted Up; 'Revenge,' 'Happy Endings,' 'Raising Hope' Adjusted Down|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=October 6, 2011|accessdate=October 6, 2011}} |ShortSummary= When a pregnant thirteen-year-old girl refuses to identify her baby's father, Detective Benson and the SVU squad work to determine if she was raped. Their investigation leads to several men in her life including Tripp Raines ([[Jacob Kogan]]), the teenage son of high-profile political couple Andrew and Kathleen Raines ([[Kyle MacLachlan]] and [[Paige Turco]]) and Arturo Rivera ([[imdbname:2864800|Anthony Keyvan]]), the son of the Raines' housekeeper ([[Judy Reyes]]) The detectives uncover much more than they bargained for when a Raines family secret is revealed and a family member goes missing. * Inspired by the [[Arnold Schwarzenegger#Infidelity and divorce|infidelity and divorce of Arnold Schwarzenegger]]. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=4 |EpisodeNumber2=276 |Title=Double Strands |DirectedBy=[[imdbname:0076681|Fred Berner]] |WrittenBy=[[imdbname:1038120|John P. Roche]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|10|12}} |ProdCode=13004 |Aux4= 7.34{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/10/13/wednesday-final-ratings-up-all-night-the-middle-suburgatory-modern-family-criminal-minds-adjusted-up-happy-endings-adjusted-down/107149/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'Up All Night,' 'The Middle,' 'Suburgatory,' 'Modern Family' 'Criminal Minds' Adjusted Up; 'Happy Endings' Adjusted Down|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=October 13, 2011|accessdate=October 14, 2011}} |ShortSummary= A dancer is followed home and raped by a man with a distinctive tattoo and the details of the attack remind Detective Rollins of a serial rapist she was tracking back home. The detectives arrest Gabriel Thomas ([[T.R. Knight]]), a family man who maintains his innocence, but his description and DNA match this assault and the string of rapes across multiple states that Rollins had been investigating. Although the evidence supports the arrest, the more Detectives Benson and Amaro dig into Thomas' past, the more they begin to believe his story. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=5 |EpisodeNumber2=277 |Title=Missing Pieces |DirectedBy=[[imdbname:0504716|Peter Leto]] |WrittenBy=Warren Leight & Julie Martin |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|10|19}} |ProdCode=13005 |Aux4=7.66{{cite web |url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/10/20/wednesday-final-ratings-modern-family-the-middle-harrys-law-law-order-svu-antm-adjusted-up/107978/ |title= Wednesday Final Ratings: 'Modern Family,' 'The Middle,' 'Harry's Law,' 'Law & Order: SVU' & 'ANTM' Adjusted Up |work=TV by the Numbers |last=Seidman |first=Robert |date=October 20, 2011 |accessdate=October 20, 2011}} |ShortSummary= A young woman ([[imdbname:2436809|Lisa Joyce]]) visiting from Buffalo claims that her car was stolen outside a Manhattan convenience store with her baby still buckled in the backseat. Detectives Benson and Amaro get as much information as they can from the anxious mother and her boyfriend (Dennis Flanagan) at the police station, while Detectives Tutuola and Rollins track their path from Buffalo for clues. When the parents' stories don't add up, the detectives must uncover what really happened to the missing baby, and the truth surprises everyone. Amaro's 4-year-old daughter named Zara ([[imdbname:4731251|Alison Fernandez]]) is introduced in this episode". |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=6 |EpisodeNumber2=278 |Title=True Believers |DirectedBy=[[Courtney Hunt]] |WrittenBy=[[Robin Veith]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|11|02}} |ProdCode=13006 |Aux4=7.10{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/11/03/wednesday-final-ratings-survivor-adjusted-up-to-season-high-x-factor-the-middle-modern-family-adjusted-up-happy-endings-adjusted-down/109504/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'Survivor' Adjusted Up to Season High; 'X Factor,' 'The Middle,' 'Modern Family' Adjusted Up; 'Happy Endings' Adjusted Down|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}} |ShortSummary=A young music student ([[Sofia Vassilieva]]) is raped at gunpoint in her own apartment, but with her help, the SVU squad makes a quick arrest. Bureau Chief Mike Cutter takes over the case when he finds that opposing counsel is high-profile defense attorney Bayard Ellis ([[Andre Braugher]]). As Ellis works to undermine their police work and damage the victim's credibility, the detectives take the stand to prove they have more than just a he-said, she-said case. * When Sgt. Munch introduces himself in the squad room, Andre Braugher's character comments: "Have we met?" This is a reference to the fact that Braugher played opposite Richard Belzer's character Munch for six seasons on ''Homicide: Life on the Street.'' "It's kind of funny because Munch has been in both of these worlds, and here I am basically in Munch's world appearing as someone else, so there's a cute little meet and greet," Braugher told ''TV Guide.'' "I say 'Have we met?' There's a glimmer before we get down to brass tax in the show basically to acknowledge we know each other and that we spent a significant amount of time together."{{Cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Andre-Braugher-1039235.aspx|title=Andre Braugher on SVU: "He May Be the Enemy, But He's Not a Villain|work=TV Guide|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|date=November 1, 2011|accessdate=November 14, 2011}} |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=7 |EpisodeNumber2=279 |Title=Russian Brides |DirectedBy=[[Alex Chapple]] |WrittenBy=Bryan Goluboff |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|11|09}} |ProdCode=13007 |Aux4=6.70{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/11/10/wednesday-final-ratings-the-x-factor-survivor-americas-next-top-model-adjusted-up/110322/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'The X Factor,' 'Survivor' & 'America's Next Top Model' Adjusted Up|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=November 10, 2011|accessdate=November 10, 2011}} |ShortSummary= When a young woman is found brutally murdered, the SVU detectives use her distinctive tattoos to identify her as a recently engaged Russian mail-order bride. Upon questioning her distraught fiancÃ©, they learn that she was kidnapped and held for ransom the night of their engagement party. While the detectives follow the money to a deadly blackmail scam run by the Russian Mafia, Captain Cragen ([[Dann Florek]]) goes undercover as a sad and lonely suitor to lure out a killer. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=8 |EpisodeNumber2=280 |Title=Educated Guess |DirectedBy= [[imdbname:0286517|Arthur W. Forney]] |WrittenBy= [[Judith McCreary]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|11|16}} |ProdCode=13008 |Aux4= 7.33{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/11/17/wednesday-final-ratings-the-x-factor-the-middle-suburgatory-modern-family-adjusted-up/111033/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'The X Factor,' 'The Middle,' 'Suburgatory' & 'Modern Family' Adjusted Up|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=November 17, 2011|accessdate=November 17, 2011}} |ShortSummary= A man in custody ([[imdbname:3481003|David Gelles]]) at a mental hospital claims to have witnessed a rape in a break room. Despite the witness' shaky credibility the SVU begins an investigation, but the alleged victim, Gia Eskas ([[Natasha Lyonne]]), denies being assaulted. Detectives Benson and Rollins struggle to piece together what really happened to this young woman, especially when her aunt ([[Carrie Preston]]) and mother say Gia has been repeatedly institutionalized, and has cried rape in the past. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=9 |EpisodeNumber2=281 |Title=Lost Traveler |DirectedBy=[[Jean de Segonzac]] |WrittenBy=Julie Martin & David Matthews |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|11|30}} |ProdCode=13009 |Aux4=9.90{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/12/01/wednesday-final-ratings-harrys-law-adjusted-down/112392/|title=Wednesday Final Ratings: 'Harry's Law' Adjusted Down|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=December 1, 2011|accessdate=December 1, 2011}} |ShortSummary= Nico Grey ([[imdbname:4398294|Cameron Ocasio]]), a Romani child, disappears on his way home from school. Benson and Amaro interview the distraught parents, who are distrustful of the police. The initial investigation leads Fin and Rollins to the powerful leader of the Romani community ([[Mark Margolis]]), but he denies any involvement. The family remains hopeful their boy will be found, especially when they discover his cell phone is still active. With the help TARU tech Leo Gerber ([[Gilbert Gottfried]]) and a meddling newspaper reporter with a powerful defense attorney ([[Ron Rifkin]]), the detectives narrow the perpetrators to a mentally challenged neighbor named Marc Rajic ([[imdbname:2683982|Michael Barra]]), throwing the tight-knit Romani community into turmoil. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=10 |EpisodeNumber2=282 |Title=Spiraling Down |RTitle={{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Exclusive: Law & Order: SVU Drafts Treat Williams for Guest Spot|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Treat-Williams-1039469.aspx|accessdate=November 7, 2011|newspaper=''TV Guide''|date=November 7, 2011}} |DirectedBy=TBA |WrittenBy=TBA |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2011|12|07}} |ProdCode=13010 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary= A military colleague of Detective Amaro's wife ([[Laura Benanti]]) reports his 14-year-old daughter missing. The detectives find the girl working as a prostitute under a possessive pimp. They quickly set up a sting operation to entrap Johns on rape charges with a minor, and arrest aging pro quarterback Jake Stanton ([[Treat Williams]]). Detective Benson and ADA Cabot seek to make an example out of the football legend, but the case is thrown into chaos with the return of defense attorney Bayard Ellis (Andre Braugher), who questions Stanton's mental capacity after years of injuries on the field. |LineColor=E2010A }}{{Episode list/sublist|List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes |EpisodeNumber=11 |EpisodeNumber2=283 |Title=Official Story |RTitle={{cite news|last=Wright|first=Adam|title=SVU Scoop: Holt McCallany to Guest-Star - Exclusive Details|url=http://tvdonewright.com/2011/11/svu-scoop-holt-mccallany-to-guest-star-exclusive-details/|accessdate=November 30, 2011|newspaper=''TVDoneWright.com''|date=November 30, 2011}} |DirectedBy=TBA |WrittenBy=TBA |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2012|1|}} |ProdCode=13011 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary= |LineColor=E2010A }} |} == References == {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * [http://www.nbc.com/law-and-order-special-victims-unit/about/recaps/#cat=13 Official episode guide] * [http://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/law-order-special-victims-unit/episodes-season-13/100257 Season 13 episodes] at [[TVGuide.com]] * [http://tv.msn.com/tv/series-episodes/law-and-order-special-victims-unit.1/ Season 13 episodes] at [[MSN.com]] * [http://www.tv.com/shows/law-order-special-victims-unit/season-13/ Season 13 episodes] at [[TV.com]] * [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0203259/episodes#season-13 Season 13 episodes] at [[IMDb.com]] * [http://lawandorder.wikia.com/wiki/SVU_Season_13 ''Law & Order: Special Victims Unit'' Season 13] on the [http://lawandorder.wikia.com/wiki/Law_&_Order_wiki Law & Order wiki] {{sequence | prev= [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 12)|Season 12]] | list=[[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes|Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
